section.name: Workspace

div.p: An example of a workspace: the content workspace.

section.p: Workspaces are spaces to do a particular kind of work. While working in a workspace, you don't see the other workspaces, so you can focus on your work.

In the CMS, users can perform many actions and the CMS can show many types of information. There are too many actions possible to fit buttons for all of them in a single window and there are too many types of information to fit panels for them on a single window.
It would also not be desirable to fit all in a single window (at once), because e.g. authors are not supposed to do user administration, so need not be bothered with buttons and panels for that.
Therefor, you see only one workspace at a time, which contains the buttons and panels you need for a particular kind of work.
An author can use the content workspace and the home workspace.

ul.li: If you are doing the tour, use the back button of your browser to continue. (There is no hyperlink here, because you can get here from many different pages.)
